title.narrative: 1.2 COMMUNITY_ INTEGRATED PACKAGE

description.narrative: Output 1.2: By 2018, targeted community health workers (male and female) offer a simplified package of evidence based quality, high impact preventive, promotional and curative interventions for maternal, neonatal, child and adolescent health and support improved demand for services, which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Child Health, Health Systems Strengthening, Maternal And Newborn Health. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 1: Children under 5 years of age and pregnant women, particularly the most vulnerable, increasingly benefit from quality high-impact interventions for the prevention and management of maternal and childhood illnesses, including in emergency situations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 1.2: By 2018, targeted community health workers (male and female) offer a simplified package of evidence based quality, highimpact preventive, promotional and curative interventions for maternal, neonatal, child and adolescent health and support improveddemand for services

description.narrative: Significant efforts are made in 2018 to institutionalize community health and consolidate achievements of iCCM implementation. The Community Health Strategic Plan 2019-2023 has been developed and the scaling up of iCCM comprehensive package has been extended to cover 86 municipalities in 23 health districts of six regions. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/01/2019

title.narrative: Health workers in UNICEF supported programmes trained in Rapid Diagnostic Testing for malaria in children

Investment case in Health initiated/ finalized with focus on I-CCM

accountability framework on ICCM developed and validated (between MoH , Min community Dev , Municipalities, NGOs)
